group_1.narration: All I could do was nod along@as the professor explained what I'd missed.
It was common knowledge among experts...@Which explained why nobody had ever thought it was a kofun.

group_1.textCenter: (I just got complimented on doing a good job@"for a high-school student.")
(If I wasn't a kid in high school...)
(He probably wouldn't have even bothered to@call.)

group_1.textLeft: Hm?
...Oh. Yeah.

group_1.textRight: What's wrong?@You've been acting oddly all day.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah... I'm in a funk.
It looks like...
The hill wasn't a kofun after all.
Yep. I went to see the university professor...
And he pointed out the flaws in my theory.
I mean, I knew that archaeology was outside of@my wheelhouse?
I've always been too much of an omnivore.@Picking up an interest in everything I could...
Not just Japanese or world history, but local@history, ancient art history, etcetera...
My history teacher practically begged me to just@pick one.
I guess I've read a lot of books and essays?@I was really hooked on it for a while.
But...@It seems like my theory was pretty outlandish.
The sort of thing that an expert with college or@grad school training would dismiss out of hand.
I was able to run this far with it because I'm a@high-school amateur...
...And that's the only reason the adults paid me@any attention, either.

group_1.textRight: .......[wait:1.0][chara:304001:lipSynch_1]I'm curious about why you intuited that@it was a kofun to begin with.
I imagine it's difficult to put into words, but@you felt something kofun-like about it, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah.

group_1.textRight: While you may not be an expert, you've still@stockpiled quite a lot of literary experience.
I can easily imagine something from that experience@telling you, instinctively, that it was a kofun.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, now that you mention it...
That's what I thought as soon as I saw the@aerial photos.
The roads around a kofun come in patterns that@differ from natural topography.
Nearly all the large-scale kofuns I've seen@before in photos were keyhole-shaped.
The aerial photos reminded me of those old@ones...
Which is what prompted me to think of a kofun to@begin with.
Yeah. So I was convinced that it'd be a large@circular kofun...
I didn't consider that it could've been a@keyhole type!

group_1.textRight: But the hill isn't keyhole-shaped at all,@right?

group_1.textLeft: ...Exactly. That's why I overlooked this@possibility.
The possibility that it could've started as a@keyhole kofun...
And ended up as a regular, round hill after@the rectangular part eroded away!
Sorry, Kira. I can't go home just yet today.
There's something I want to re-investigate.
[chara:303801:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]Thanks for the advice! Kira, I love you!

group_1.textCenter: I knew it. The land here...
It could've originally been a keyhole kofun!
